beforeHooks.title: "before all" hook in "{root}"

afterHooks.title: "after all" hook in "{root}"
afterHooks.code: await mongoose.connection.close() // Close the database connection after tests

tests.title: should fetch all subscribers
tests.fullTitle: Subscribers API should fetch all subscribers
tests.code:
const res = await request(app).get('/subscribers')
expect(res.status).to.equal(200)
expect(res.body).to.be.an('array')
expect(res.body[0]).to.have.property('name')
expect(res.body[0]).to.have.property('subscribedChannel')

tests.title: should fetch subscribers by name
tests.fullTitle: Subscribers API should fetch subscribers by name
tests.code:
const res = await request(app).get('/subscribers/names')
expect(res.status).to.equal(200)
expect(res.body).to.be.an('array')
expect(res.body[0]).to.have.property('name')
expect(res.body[0]).to.have.property('subscribedChannel')

tests.fullTitle: Subscribers API should create a new subscriber

tests.title: should create a new subscriber with name and channel only
tests.fullTitle: Subscribers API should create a new subscriber with name and channel only

tests.title: should fetch a subscriber by ID
tests.fullTitle: Subscribers API should fetch a subscriber by ID
tests.code:
const subscriber = await Subscriber.findOne()
const res = await request(app).get(`/subscribers/${subscriber._id}`) // Corrected with backticks
expect(res.status).to.equal(200)
expect(res.body).to.have.property('name')
expect(res.body).to.have.property('subscribedChannel')

tests.title: should return 404 for non-existing subscriber ID
tests.fullTitle: Subscribers API should return 404 for non-existing subscriber ID
tests.code:
const nonExistingId = new mongoose.Types.ObjectId()
const res = await request(app).get(`/subscribers/${nonExistingId}`) // Corrected with backticks
expect(res.status).to.equal(404)
expect(res.body).to.have.property('message', 'Subscriber not found')
